newsitem.title: BELGIUM: EU industry output up 1.1 percent in Feb-April.
newsitem.headline: EU industry output up 1.1 percent in Feb-April.

text.p: European Union industrial production rose 1.1 percent between February and April compared with the previous three months, Eurostat said Friday.
"All member states with available data recorded a rise, the largest being Spain's 2.5 percent and Sweden's 2.0 percent," Eurostat, the EU's statistical office, said.
Finland and Italy also experienced growth rates above the EU average, up by 1.5 percent and 1.3 percent respectively.
Britain had the lowest growth in industrial production with a rise of only 0.3 percent.
Compared with the same period last year, EU industry production rose by 2.7 percent, well below 4.5 percent in the United States and 5.9 percent in Japan.
Eurostat's figures cover industry production volume, excluding construction, and are adjusted for seasonal and one-time fluctuations.
